intro: Fuirena camptotricha, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Fuirena camptotricha typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
